channel.title: BBC News - UK Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Ministers wait to hear if they face self-isolation after Javid tests positive
item.description: Health Secretary Sajid Javid, who has tested positive for Covid, is isolating and working from home.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine offered to all UK adults, says government
item.description: More than two-thirds of people have had both doses as England prepares for rules to ease on Monday.

item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed arrivals from France must still quarantine
item.description: A planned relaxation of England's rules from Monday will not apply due to cases of the Beta variant.

item.title: Blackpool councillor 'fat shamed' by MP over critical tweet
item.description: A Blackpool councillor claims a comment one of the town's MPs made in reply to his tweet was "nasty".

item.title: UK looks to extend ivory ban to hippos and other animals
item.description: Ministers say elephants are not the only animals at risk from hunters, as they launch consultation.

item.title: I will sweat blood to win voters' respect, says Sir Keir Starmer
item.description: The Labour leader tells the BBC his party has a "trust issue", after talking to some of its ex-voters.

item.title: Boris Johnson's university friend gets ethics watchdog role
item.description: Labour accuses Boris Johnson of "cronyism" but the government says proper processes were followed.

item.title: GB News says presenter Guto Harri breached standards by taking the knee
item.description: Guto Harri is not expected to appear for the rest of the summer after making the gesture on air.

item.title: Foreign aid: Government facing legal action over £4bn cuts
item.description: A UK-based charity argues a legally-binding target must be changed before spending can be reduced.

item.title: Homes raided in inquiry into Matt Hancock CCTV leak
item.description: Investigators want to know who obtained images of the ex-minister kissing an aide in his office.

item.title: Colum Eastwood: MP reveals death threats after naming Soldier F
item.description: Colum Eastwood named the former paratrooper, accused of two Bloody Sunday murders, in Parliament.

item.title: NI Troubles: 'Robust conversation' as parties meet Lewis over legacy
item.description: The UK proposals have been widely rejected by the executive parties, Irish government and victims.

item.title: Levelling up: Boris Johnson promises more powers for local leaders
item.description: Boris Johnson promises more power for local leaders, but Labour says his speech was "gibberish".

item.title: Government purchase of wine increases by £26,000
item.description: The "self-funding" collection of fine wines was topped up during the pandemic, figures reveal.

item.title: National Food Strategy: Tax sugar and salt and prescribe veg, report says
item.description: Boris Johnson says he will consider the proposal, but finds the idea of extra taxes on people unattractive.

item.title: Labour attacks watchdog over Lord Hammond's Saudi adviser job
item.description: The ex-chancellor will become an adviser to the Gulf state's finance minister later this month.

item.title: Ten MPs accept Euro football tickets from betting firms
item.description: One MP accepted over £7,000 worth of tickets to the football, Royal Ascot and Wimbledon.

item.title: MPs call for complete reset of music streaming to ensure fair pay for artists
item.description: The music industry is weighted against artists, who see "pitiful returns" from streaming, MPs say.

item.title: Online racists face football ban of up to 10 years, vows Boris Johnson
item.description: Social media giants will also face large fines for allowing "vile behaviour", the PM promises.

item.title: Parliament: Sexual harassment MP Rob Roberts returns to the Commons
item.description: A disgraced MP suspended for six weeks is back in the House of Commons despite calls to stay away.

item.title: Green Party: Co-leader Sian Berry quits over transgender rights row
item.description: Sian Berry says "inconsistency" on gender policy has put her in a "very difficult position".

item.title: Newport Wafer Fab: Ex-Tory leader says ministers in 'unholy mess' over chip plant sale
item.description: Sir Iain Duncan Smith says ministers should have blocked Nexperia's takeover of Newport Wafer Fab.

item.title: Racism fuelling far-right threat in UK - MI5's Ken McCallum warns
item.description: Teenagers are a growing part of the problem, with children as young as 13 drawn into extremism online.

item.title: Covid-19: Ibiza, Majorca and Menorca moved to amber travel list
item.description: It means those who are not double-jabbed or under-18 will have to quarantine on their return.

item.title: Plan to end all NI Troubles prosecutions confirmed
item.description: Boris Johnson says proposals to address past will allow people to "draw a line under the Troubles".

item.title: Price rises speed up again as economy unlocks
item.description: The inflation rate hit 2.5% in June, exceeding the Bank of England's target for a second month.

item.title: Carry on flying, says government green plan
item.description: The policy has been ridiculed by environmentalists who say the government is putting too much faith in innovation.

item.title: Government wins vote to lock in cuts to overseas aid
item.description: Boris Johnson sees off attempt by Tory MPs to restore development spending to 0.7% of national income.

item.title: Commons scraps English votes for English laws
item.description: The government says law-making will be more efficient, but the SNP says ministers have been "humiliated".

item.title: Compulsory vaccinations for care home staff in England backed by MPs
item.description: But Conservative MPs criticise the government for not publishing an impact assessment before the vote.

item.title: Bloody Sunday: Colum Eastwood names Soldier F in parliament
item.description: The identity of a former paratrooper, accused of two murders on Bloody Sunday, had been kept anonymous.

item.title: England's Tyrone Mings criticises Patel over racism response
item.description: England's Tyrone Mings accuses the home secretary of "pretending" to be disgusted by racist abuse.

item.title: PM must level up the North at pace, say Tory MPs
item.description: The Northern Research Group say ministers must start delivering on promises to rebuild after the pandemic.

item.title: English votes: A beginner's guide
item.description: The government wants to scrap "English votes for English laws" - we explain what the procedure means.

item.title: Keir Starmer quizzed by former Labour voters in Blackpool
item.description: The Labour leader speaks to an audience in Blackpool about three of his policy priorities.

item.title: Boris Johnson sets out plan to 'level up' UK economy
item.description: Boris Johnson delivers speech in Coventry on plans to improve prospects in deprived areas of the UK.

item.title: Keir Starmer on Boris Johnson 'levelling up' speech
item.description: The prime minister “promises jam tomorrow” but fails to deliver says the Labour leader.

item.title: Anna Soubry on Conservative policies under Boris Johnson
item.description: The Conservative Party now “marches now to a very different drum beat” says one of its former MPs.

item.title: Eshalomi and Atkins on online racism and diversity in politics
item.description: An MP quotes a YMCA report saying 95% of black children say they have witnessed racism in education.

item.title: Coventry City of Culture: The women who helped shape a 'city of justice'
item.description: Coventry women have always been at the heart of the struggle for social justice, a historian says.

item.title: PMQs: What did Boris Johnson say about the booing of England players?
item.description: Labour challenged the prime minister over his position on those who booed England when they "took the knee".

item.title: Foreign aid: Who will be hit by the UK government cuts?
item.description: The UK government is reducing its spending this year on foreign aid - with major consequences for some recipients.

item.title: What more can be done to stop racist abuse online?
item.description: Abuse directed at England footballers has prompted calls for more action to tackle hate online.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Covid: Will free school meals continue over summer holidays?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Does political pressure shape pandemic decisions?
item.description: With Scotland and England on the road out of lockdown, does political pressure encourage a "four nation" approach?

item.title: Ministers see off MPs' attempts to amend new crime bill
item.description: MPs have approved controversial new public order laws but ministers signal concessions to come.
